jobs.title: Switchboard Hiring - Active Candidate Network
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join our Active Candidate Network!

At Switchboard, we’re always on the lookout for talented individuals like you. Whether you're actively searching for a new role or simply exploring opportunities, sharing your resume with us ensures you're considered for future positions that align with your skills, experience, and career goals.

Why Join Our Network?

  • Stay on our radar for new job opportunities.

  • Be among the first to know about openings that match your expertise.

How It Works:

  1. Submit your resume to our Active Candidate Network.

  2. Answer a few quick questions to help us understand your ideal role.

  3. When a position opens that fits your profile, we’ll reach out to you!

jobs.title: Attorney (Construction, Real Estate & Business Law)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Switchboard has been engaged by our client, Volpe Law, to find an experienced Attorney for their team. Volpe Law was built to be everything Big Law isn't—a place where candor beats corporate speak, tenacity trumps timesheets, and people matter more than billables.
If you want to build a meaningful practice without sacrificing your life to do it, we want to hear from you!

About Volpe Law

We're a small but mighty law firm based in Parker, CO —specializing in business, construction, and real estate law. We say the hard thing when it's the right thing—even if it's not the easy thing. At Volpe Law, high performance doesn't require human sacrifice. Our clients feel protected. Our team feels proud. And everyone gets to have a life outside these walls.

Job Details

  • Location: Parker, CO (Hybrid)

  • Compensation: $110,000 - $175,000

  • Benefits: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k) match, paid time off

What You Will Do

  • Provide advice and representation to clients in construction, real estate, and business law, becoming a trusted advisor for their legal needs.

  • Conduct depositions, hearings, trials, and appeals.

  • Draft pleadings, motions, briefs, and other legal documents with precision, articulating complex legal concepts clearly.

  • Manage all phases of litigation cases—from pre-litigation strategy through trial representation.

  • Collaborate directly with construction and business clients to revise, negotiate, and draft contracts that protect their interests.

  • Manage a diverse caseload from inception through resolution while maintaining high standards of client service.

Who We Are Looking For

  • Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an accredited law school with an active license to practice law in Colorado.

  • Minimum 5 years of experience practicing law.

  • Experience in civil litigation; construction litigation preferred.

  • Strong analytical thinker who can solve complex problems effectively while managing multiple priorities and meeting deadlines.

  • Excellent written and verbal communicator who can translate complex legal issues into clear, actionable advice for clients.

  • Detail-oriented legal drafter who takes pride in producing high-quality work product.


Interview Process

  1. Submit your application - Consider this your first interview! We are evaluating your ability to communicate effectively and genuinely; your responses will determine if you move to the next stage.

  2. Recruiter Screen - 30 minute video interview with a Switchboard recruiter

  3. Hiring Manager Interview - 60 minute video interview with Ben, Founding Member of Volpe Law

  4. Final Interview - 60 minute-in person interview with additional Volpe Law team members

jobs.title: Structural Engineer (PE certification)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Switchboard Hiring is looking for a Structural Engineer (PE) on behalf of our client, Cronin Engineering. If you're looking to learn, get out in the field, and be part of a growing company with advancement opportunities, let's talk.

About Cronin Engineering

We're a small company with big plans, but we won't sacrifice our culture in the process. At Cronin Engineering, we believe there is more than one way to advance your career. Here, you will get exposure to residential projects, small scope commercial projects, and inspection/forensic work, with the opportunity to specialize in areas that interest you most. Our commitment to you is to help you discover that path, whether it be management or specialization in one of our three areas. To learn more about our culture, check us out on Instagram.

Job Details

  • Location: Centennial, CO (Hybrid)

  • Hours: Full-time, mix of in-office, remote, and field

  • Compensation: $80,000 - $100,000

  • Benefits: medical, dental, 401K match, development assistance, discretionary bonus

  • Sponsorship: Sponsorship not available. Position only available to those within the US with legal authorization to work.

About This Role

As a Structural Engineer you will:

  • Design and analyze structural systems for diverse projects - from residential renovations to small commercial builds, working on short timelines in a fast-paced environment.

  • Spend 20-40% of your time in the field conducting structural inspections, foundation assessments, and forensic evaluations.

  • Collaborate & communicate directly with architects, contractors, and clients to deliver innovative solutions that meet tight deadlines.

  • Prepare detailed engineering drawings, specifications, and construction documents while ensuring compliance with building codes.

Who We Are Looking For

  • Bachelor's degree in engineering and Professional Engineer (PE) certification required.

  • Previous experience working as a structural engineer required. Design experience and residential structural experience preferred, but not required.

  • Technical proficiency with Mathcad, Bluebeam, and Autodesk products (Revit/AutoCAD).

  • Self-starter looking to grow with a small, ambitious engineering firm with advancement opportunities.

  • Strong communicator who can discuss complex issues with diverse stakeholders and deliver both good and challenging news professionally.

  • Someone that isn't afraid to get their hands (or shoes) dirty and get the job done.

Interview Process

  1. Submit your application - Consider this your first interview! We are evaluating your ability to communicate effectively and genuinely; your responses will determine if you move to the next stage.

  2. Recruiter Screen - 30 minute video interview with a recruiter

  3. In Person Interview - 90 minute interview with Cronin team leaders

  4. Final Interview - 60 minute in-person interview to meet the rest of the team

jobs.title: Structural Engineer (EI certification)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Switchboard Hiring is looking for a Structural Engineer (EI) on behalf of our client, Cronin Engineering. If you're looking to learn, get out in the field, and be part of a growing company with advancement opportunities, let's talk.

About Cronin Engineering

We're a small company with big plans, but we won't sacrifice our culture in the process. At Cronin Engineering, we believe there is more than one way to advance your career. Here, you will get exposure to residential projects, small scope commercial projects, and inspection/forensic work, with the opportunity to specialize in areas that interest you most. Our commitment to you is to help you discover that path, whether it be management or specialization in one of our three areas. To learn more about our culture, check us out on Instagram.

Job Details

  • Location: Centennial, CO (Hybrid)

  • Hours: Full-time, mix of in-office, remote, and field

  • Compensation: $60,000 - $80,000

  • Benefits: medical, dental, 401K match, development assistance, discretionary bonus

  • Sponsorship: Sponsorship not available. Position only available to those within the US with legal authorization to work.

About This Role

As a Structural Engineer you will:

  • Design and analyze structural systems for diverse projects - from residential renovations to small commercial builds, working on short timelines in a fast-paced environment.

  • Spend 20-40% of your time in the field conducting structural inspections, foundation assessments, and forensic evaluations.

  • Collaborate & communicate directly with architects, contractors, and clients to deliver innovative solutions that meet tight deadlines.

  • Prepare detailed engineering drawings, specifications, and construction documents while ensuring compliance with building codes.

Who We Are Looking For

  • Self-starter looking to grow with a small, ambitious engineering firm with advancement opportunities.

  • Someone that isn't afraid to get their hands (or shoes) dirty and get the job done.

  • Strong communicator who can discuss complex issues with diverse stakeholders and deliver both good and challenging news professionally.

  • Bachelor's degree in engineering with 1-2 years of structural engineering experience.

  • Engineer in Training (EIT) or Professional Engineer (PE) certification required. Technical proficiency with Mathcad, Bluebeam, and Autodesk products (Revit/AutoCAD).

  • Design experience and residential structural experience preferred, but not required.

Interview Process

  1. Submit your application - Consider this your first interview! We are evaluating your ability to communicate effectively and genuinely; your responses will determine if you move to the next stage.

  2. Recruiter Screen - 30 minute video interview with a recruiter

  3. In Person Interview - 90 minute interview with Cronin team leaders

  4. Final Interview - 60 minute in-person interview to meet the rest of the team
